thread.title: Result: Queen of the South win tight game against Greenock Morton
thread.title_full: Result: Queen of the South win tight game against Greenock Morton

title: Result: Queen of the South win tight game against Greenock Morton
text:
Result: Queen of the South win tight game against Greenock Morton © Getty Images Queen of the South beat Greenock Morton 1-0 in a hard-fought encounter at Palmerstown Park to remain fifth in the Scottish Championship, while Morton stay in sixth. Filed: Saturday, October 10, 2015 at 16:54 UK Last Updated: Saturday, October 10, 2015 at 16:55 UK 
Queen of the South won a hard-fought encounter against Greenock Morton to remain in fifth position in the Scottish Championship. 
Queens took the lead after 15 minutes through top scorer Derek Lyle . 
Lyle rose highest to power Alex Harris 's cross past Morton keeper Derek Gaston , for his fourth of the league season. 
Gaston kept Queens' advantage to just one goal with a flying save from Harris' long-range effort. 
The Ton started the second half in attacking fashion but Bobby Barr failed to bring his side back on level terms from close range. 
On-loan Swansea City forward Alex Samuel then missed a chance from eight yards out as Greenock continued to attack. 
However, the Ton were unable to make their second-half pressure count as Queens edged a tight encounter. 
Greenock remain in sixth in the table following the loss. Enter your email address to subscribe to Sports Mole 's free match previews newsletter! Updates are sent twice a week.
